cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 mi SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest over the south-central Gulf, then turning north-northwest and north toward the Louisiana coast, on track to cross inland and accelerate north-northeastward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southwest Louisiana coast, roughly between Cameron and Grand Chenier

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Grand Isle, LA to Bay St. Louis, MS, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: None affecting New Orleans at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island, TX to the AL/FL border, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are increasingly likely Friday afternoon into Saturday; brief gusts near hurricane force cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft possible on Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and adjacent tidal waterways affecting the New Orleans area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally up to 12 inches Friday–Saturday may cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes Friday–Friday night; dangerous seas, high waves and rip currents along approaches to the lower Mississippi River and coastal terminals.
